title: Just Change
desc: We will address access to ladders of opportunity including employment, education, housing, and civic participation in the electoral process.? In addition, we will discuss policy recommendations that reflect what communities in the Northeast ?need from their federal government to ensure that all of its citizens can pursue the American Dream.? Daryl Atkinsons, BJA Justice Fellow will open and frame the day in the context of our history and author Kemba Smith will address the need for gender responsive strategies in criminal justice reform. ?Equally important, constituents will be able to hear from members of the ? about the unprecedented efforts the federal government has taken to ensure that all people have access to opportunity.
